label: ham
subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Forecast For User|AVCAVC
body: The strongest is never strong enough to be always the master, unless he transforms strength into right, and obedience into duty. Hence the right of the strongest, which, though to all seeming meant ironically, is really laid down as a fundamental principle. But are we never to have an explanation of this phrase? Force is a physical power, and I fail to see what moral effect it can have. To yield to force is an act of necessity, not of will--at the most, an act of prudence. In what sense can it be a duty?
